title: Design and Application of VR/AR-Based Science Education Simulations

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Math-science integrated inquiry activities using VR/AR technologies in BYOD environments. Learning outcomes measured through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can develop the ability to design scientific phenomenon simulations using mathematical modeling tools in VR/AR environments.

During the mid-term course (3 weeks), learners will analyze three given datasets using digital inquiry tools (such as Desmos, GeoGebra), create at least two types of visualization outputs (graphs/charts), and produce a report that meets at least four of the five peer assessment rubric criteria.
Learners can develop integrated science-technology-engineering thinking skills through collaborative problem-solving processes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
